repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/34231

comment_data.body: Before anyone starts screaming at me: Yes, I know that I said I would put this under `vim.lsp.buf` but I need to access a lot of local state in this module so I'm putting it here for now. Open to exposing the public entry point somewhere else later.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -435,4 +436,83 @@ function M._enable(bufnr)
   end
 end
 
+--- Returns the result IDs from the reports provided by the given client.
+--- @return lsp.PreviousResultId[]
+local function previous_result_ids(client_id)
+  local results = {}
+
+  for bufnr, state in pairs(bufstates) do
+    if state.enabled then
+      for buf_client_id, result_id in pairs(state.client_result_id) do
+        if buf_client_id == client_id then
+          table.insert(results, {
+            textDocument = util.make_text_document_params(bufnr),
+            previousResultId = result_id,
+          })
+        end
+      end
+    end
+  end
+
+  return results
+end
+
+--- @class vim.lsp.WorkspaceDiagnosticsOpts
+--- @inlinedoc
+---
+--- Only return diagnostics from the indicated client. If nil, diagnostics from all clients are returned.
+--- @field client_id? integer
+
+--- Returns workspace-wide diagnostics.
+--- @param opts? vim.lsp.WorkspaceDiagnosticsOpts
+--- @see https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-current/#workspace_dagnostics
+function M.workspace_diagnostics(opts)

comment_data.body:
could mark this as internal-only (underscore prefix) and call it from `vim.lsp.buf.foo()`.

not a blocker.

comment_data.body: Yeah I guess we can do that.

comment_data.body: @gpanders any suggestions on how to document the recommended usage of this function? Not sure if invoking it at regular intervals with a timer would be the best, but idk what event to suggest here either.
As a reference from the spec: "In contrast to the document diagnostic request the workspace request can be long running and is not bound to a specific workspace or document state."
It doesn't feel right to use `sleep` but if I don't then this test might just become a no-op since diagnostics are likely to be empty before the workspace request is processed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6779,4 +6779,76 @@ describe('LSP', function()
       eq(false, exec_lua([[return vim.lsp.is_enabled('foo')]]))
     end)
   end)
+
+  describe('vim.lsp.buf.workspace_diagnostics()', function()
+    --- @param kind lsp.DocumentDiagnosticReportKind
+    local function setup_server(kind)
+      exec_lua(create_server_definition)
+      exec_lua(function()
+        _G.server = _G._create_server({
+          capabilities = {
+            diagnosticProvider = { workspaceDiagnostics = true },
+          },
+          handlers = {
+            ['workspace/diagnostic'] = function(_, _, callback)
+              callback(nil, {
+                items = {
+                  {
+                    kind = kind,
+                    uri = 'file:///fake/uri',
+                    items = {
+                      {
+                        range = {
+                          start = { line = 1, character = 1 },
+                          ['end'] = { line = 1, character = 1 },
+                        },
+                        message = 'Error here!',
+                        severity = 1,
+                      },
+                    },
+                  },
+                },
+              })
+            end,
+          },
+        })
+        vim.lsp.start({ name = 'dummy', cmd = _G.server.cmd })
+        vim.lsp.buf.workspace_diagnostics()
+      end, { kind })
+    end
+
+    it('updates diagnostics obtained with vim.diagnostic.get()', function()
+      setup_server('full')
+
+      retry(nil, nil, function()
+        eq(
+          1,
+          exec_lua(function()
+            return #vim.diagnostic.get()
+          end)
+        )
+      end)
+
+      eq(
+        'Error here!',
+        exec_lua(function()
+          return vim.diagnostic.get()[1].message
+        end)
+      )
+    end)
+
+    it('ignores unchanged diagnostic reports', function()
+      setup_server('unchanged')
+
+      eq(
+        0,
+        exec_lua(function()
+          -- Wait for diagnostics to be processed.
+          vim.uv.sleep(50)

comment_data.body:
can you use `retry()` to assert the state change? e.g.

    retry(<diagnostics are NOT empty>)  -- waits until diagnostics are added

comment_data.body: is that a decision we need to make right now?
nit: place it near the other workspace functions? https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/96a0e5f265d11e7913ce71a3a1981b267bda79e5/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/buf.lua#L1009
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1311,4 +1311,19 @@ function M.execute_command(command_params)
   lsp.buf_request(0, ms.workspace_executeCommand, command_params)
 end

comment_data.body: No. We can add the documentation examples later.

comment_data.body: The thing with this test is that I want to assert that diagnostics _are not_ added. If I use `retry` then it will immediately succeed, but I want to make sure that even after processing the request `vim.diagnostic.get` returns nothing.

comment_data.body: Is it worth supporting `vim.lsp.get_clients.Filter` here. E.g. all client_ids attached to this buffer, or client_id's with this name?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1855,6 +1855,18 @@ typehierarchy({kind})                            *vim.lsp.buf.typehierarchy()*
     Parameters: ~
       • {kind}  (`"subtypes"|"supertypes"`)
 
+workspace_diagnostics({opts})            *vim.lsp.buf.workspace_diagnostics()*
+    Request workspace-wide diagnostics.
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {opts}  (`table?`) A table with the following fields:

comment_data.body: I think that just filtering by `client_id` is sufficient for now. We can always make this more flexible if requested.

comment_regular_data.body: do we need to exercise this with a basic test?

> do we need to exercise this with a basic test?

Yep, I'll be adding one sometime this week.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): workspace diagnostic support
